intro: Rinorea angustifolia subsp. myrsinifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rinorea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, ovate leaves with a glossy surface. Its flowers are typically pale pink or white, with five petals and numerous stamens, making it visually striking. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
